name: Vampiric Mist (A)
resistance: acid, cold, lightning, necrotic, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
conimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Source
traits.desc: tales from the yawning portal,  page 247

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.desc: A vampiric mist doesn't require air or sleep.

traits.name: Blood Sense
traits.desc: The vampiric mist can sense living creatures that have blood or similar vital fluids in a radius of 60 feet .

traits.name: Forbiddance
traits.desc: The vampiric mist can 't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

traits.name: Misty Form
traits.desc: The vampiric mist can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can pass through it without squeezing. Each foot of movement in water costs it 2 extra feet, rather than 1 extra foot. The mist can't manipulate objects in any way that requires hands; it can apply simple force only.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: The vampiric mist takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, the mist has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

actions.name: Blood Drain
actions.desc: One creature in the vampiric mist's space must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw (undead and constructs automatically succeed). On a failed save, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the mist regains hit points equal to that amount. >This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the target finishes a long rest. It dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
